revised_title: Morphological Aspects of the Synaptonemal Complex in Higher Plants
tldr: The article discusses the morphological aspects of the synaptonemal complex in higher plants, focusing on its fine structure and role in chromosome pairing during meiosis. The synaptonemal complex is a tripartite structure involved in the pairing of homologous chromosomes. The authors provide electron micrographs and observations from various plants, assessing the evidence suggesting that both lateral and central elements in the complex are ribonucleoprotein structures.
